aboutLong:
Ernest Bennin is a Ph.D. candidate at the University of Tennessee, Knoxville. He holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Chemistry from the Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology (KNUST), Ghana. He is a member of the NSF Center for Computer-Assisted Synthesis (NSF-CCAS), the American Chemical Society (ACS), and NOBCChE. His current research focuses on:

*Novel ligand designs (organic synthesis)
*Rhodium paddlewheel complexes synthesis 
*Utilization of rhodium paddlewheel complexes in asymmetric catalysis
*Development of Rh(II)-based chemical sensors for chromogenic detection of biomolecules
aboutShort: Ernest Bernin is a doctoral candidate in chemistry at the University of Tennessee-Knoxville, exploring research at the intersection of ligand design, synthesis, asymmetric catalysis, and chemical probes for poisonous substance detection.
publicationsNote: For a full list of publications, please see my CV or contact me directly.

projects.title: Project / Award Title 2
projects.description: A brief description of another significant project or scholarly achievement.

research.title: Ligand Design
research.description: Designing ligands on dirhodium complexes for asymmetric catalysis and detection of organophosphate nerve agent simulants.

research.title: Catalysis and DFT conformational analysis
research.description: Developing heteroleptic symmetric catalysts for asymmetric catalysis and investigating them with DFT conformational analysis.

research.title: Computational Chemistry
research.description: Using modeling to interpret experiments, predict reactivity, and guide catalyst design.

contactAvailability: Open to collaborations and speaking opportunities.
